text:
Which stars do Belarusian opinion leaders look like in Yandex‚Äôs neural network üòÇ

06 Nov 2019, 05:30



Telegram channel "Minsk and Minsk". Unexpected alleys of Minsk, strange finds, funny details. Content is not duplicated anywhere!


I decided not to write anything serious today, but to conduct an experiment on my Facebook friends (I know most of those who got into the text personally, so I count on no offense) from among the leaders of public opinion. I took 19 people, saved the most textured pictures from the profiles, and uploaded them to the Yandex neural network through the voice assistant (assistant?) Alice. Alice, among other things, knows how to select people like you from among the stars and evaluate the degree of similarity in percent. Well, for example, I‚Äôm 18% Ramzan Kadyrov ... The results are simply excellent :) I put them in a list by increasing percentage of similarity, which in my experiment reached as much as 60%. Watch and enjoy.
Of course, anyone can indulge in the function, but I have not found how this can be done via the web, only on a mobile phone. Any Yandex application with a built-in voice assistant (in fact, the program of the same name or a separate application "Alice", or their browser) will do, where you need to call it and ask the question "Who am I like." Alice will offer to make a photo with a front camera or go to the gallery. One must, of course, understand that a different angle of inclination of the head or lighting can affect the final result, although I still most often get exactly Kadyrov:



Practice shows that a bearded double star is most often given to bearded people, and those who are wearing glasses are more likely to pick up a star with glasses.
It is clear that the lower the percentage of similarity, the less realistic the similarity is to be expected. For example, Ivan Shilo, a journalist and entrepreneur, Alice believes, this is 17% of Andrei Gubin. I personally do not see anything in common :)



Or Igor Kolchenko, the creator of Sette Studio - it's like a certain Zheka (19%). I know Kolchenko, there is no Zheka.



Entrepreneur Leonid Usnich - Armen Dzhigarkhanyan? Also past.



Journalist Anatoly Shirvel. Some cook from Russia:



Marketer Andrei Gusarov for the fifth part of Stas Pieha:



By the same amount, the chief editor of Office Life, Victor Malishevsky, Robert Downey Jr.:



Starting at 25%, a similarity does appear, and this can be seen with the naked eye. PR and event manager Antonina Yatsuk is obviously similar to actress Nastasya Samburskaya:



There is something in common between Bulanova and marketer Natalya Light ...



I apologize terribly to the photographer Daniil Anokhin for choosing a photo that is 27% Stas Mikhailov :)



Entrepreneur Sergey Kozlovsky immediately 36% Mikhail Krug! All Vladimir Central!



Blogger # 1 of this country, Anna Bond - 39% Nyusha. Or Nyusha is 39% of Anna Bond.



Now a group of ‚Äúfortieth men‚Äù. Radio host and YouTube blogger Anton Martynenko is 40% Ivan Urgant. Can not argue:



43% of the journalist Sergei Malinovsky saw Alice in singer Dmitry Malikov:



Bodybuilder and singer Pavel Syroezhkin is almost half the rapper Dzhigan:



Pavel Kramar opens a group of those whose similarity exceeds 50% according to the neural network. Moby:



56% of the activist-urbanist Anton Motolko was found in the TV presenter Andrei Malakhov (for my taste, a clear mistake, but so be it):



Lawyer Vladimir Nesmashny can easily replace actor Dmitry Nagiyev as the host of the talk show ‚ÄúWindows‚Äù and no one will notice anything!



Web designer and ultramarathoner Bogdan Korovets is already 59% of singer Meladze üòé



Well, the absolute leader of the experiment, etiquette trainer Oksana Zaretskaya, whose resemblance to Anastasia Volochkova was calculated for 60%:



To my taste, however, Kramar should have defeated with a similarity of 99% :)
